intro: Rotheca myricoides f. reflexilobata, commonly known as the reflexed-lobed rotheca, is a variant of a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, reflexed leaf lobes that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in late spring to early summer. The foliage is generally dark green and has a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal in garden settings.
